title: Chipotle’s New Steak Could Boost Second-Half Sales, Analyst Says
text:
Text size

Courtesy of Chipotle

Chipotle Mexican Grill ’s latest menu addition could help the restaurant chain to higher-than-expected results to close the year, an analyst wrote recently.

That didn’t help Chipotle’s stock (ticker: CMG) Wednesday afternoon—the shares were down 2.4% to $808.59 as the S&P 500 was off 1.9%—but SunTrust Robinson Humphrey’s Jake Bartlett nevertheless has a $900 price target on the shares, above FactSet’s $784 average and 8% above Tuesday’s close. He reiterated a Buy rating on the shares.

His optimism comes in part from what he sees as strong demand for the company’s new carne asada steak entree, released nationally last month. “Carne asada sales appear to be higher as a percentage of sales than we expected,” he wrote Tuesday.
description: The new carne asada could be a hit, according to SunTrust Robinson Humphrey’s Jake Bartlett.
